1799 void rorxl(Register dst, Register src, byte imm8);
1800 void rorxl(Register dst, Operand src, byte imm8);
1801
1802 void mfence();
1803 void lfence();
1804 void pause();
1805
1806 // Check the code size generated from label to here.
1807 int SizeOfCodeGeneratedSince(Label* label) {
1808 return pc_offset() - label->pos();
1809 }
1810
1811 // Record a deoptimization reason that can be used by a log or cpu profiler.
1812 // Use --trace-deopt to enable.
1813 void RecordDeoptReason(DeoptimizeReason reason, SourcePosition position,
1814 int id);
1815
1816 // Writes a single word of data in the code stream.
1817 // Used for inline tables, e.g., jump-tables.
1818 void db(uint8_t data);
1819 void dd(uint32_t data);
1820 void dq(uint64_t data);
1821 void dp(uintptr_t data) { dq(data); }
1822 void dq(Label* label);
1823
1824 // Patch entries for partial constant pool.
1825 void PatchConstPool();
1826
1827 // Check if use partial constant pool for this rmode.
1828 static bool UseConstPoolFor(RelocInfo::Mode rmode);
1829
1830 // Check if there is less than kGap bytes available in the buffer.
1831 // If this is the case, we need to grow the buffer before emitting
1832 // an instruction or relocation information.
1833 inline bool buffer_overflow() const {
1834 return pc_ >= reloc_info_writer.pos() - kGap;
1835 }
1836
1837 // Get the number of bytes available in the buffer.
1838 inline int available_space() const {
1839 return static_cast<int>(reloc_info_writer.pos() - pc_);
1840 }
1841
1842 static bool IsNop(Address addr);
1843
1844 // Avoid overflows for displacements etc.
1845 static constexpr int kMaximalBufferSize = 512 * MB;
1846
1847 byte byte_at(int pos) { return buffer_start_[pos]; }
1848 void set_byte_at(int pos, byte value) { buffer_start_[pos] = value; }
1849
1850#if defined(V8_OS_WIN_X64)
1851 win64_unwindinfo::BuiltinUnwindInfo GetUnwindInfo() const;
1852#endif
1853
1854 protected:
1855 // Call near indirect
1856 void call(Operand operand);
1857
1858 private:
1859 Address addr_at(int pos) {
1860 return reinterpret_cast<Address>(buffer_start_ + pos);
1861 }
1862 uint32_t long_at(int pos) {
1863 return ReadUnalignedValue<uint32_t>(addr_at(pos));
1864 }
1865 void long_at_put(int pos, uint32_t x) {
1866 WriteUnalignedValue(addr_at(pos), x);
1867 }
1868
1869 // code emission
1870 void GrowBuffer();
1871
1872 void emit(byte x) { *pc_++ = x; }
1873 inline void emitl(uint32_t x);
1874 inline void emitq(uint64_t x);
1875 inline void emitw(uint16_t x);
1876 inline void emit_runtime_entry(Address entry, RelocInfo::Mode rmode);
1877 inline void emit(Immediate x);
1878 inline void emit(Immediate64 x);
1879
1880 // Emits a REX prefix that encodes a 64-bit operand size and
1881 // the top bit of both register codes.
1882 // High bit of reg goes to REX.R, high bit of rm_reg goes to REX.B.
1883 // REX.W is set.
1884 inline void emit_rex_64(XMMRegister reg, Register rm_reg);
1885 inline void emit_rex_64(Register reg, XMMRegister rm_reg);
1886 inline void emit_rex_64(Register reg, Register rm_reg);
1887 inline void emit_rex_64(XMMRegister reg, XMMRegister rm_reg);
1888
1889 // Emits a REX prefix that encodes a 64-bit operand size and
1890 // the top bit of the destination, index, and base register codes.
1891 // The high bit of reg is used for REX.R, the high bit of op's base
1892 // register is used for REX.B, and the high bit of op's index register
1893 // is used for REX.X. REX.W is set.
1894 inline void emit_rex_64(Register reg, Operand op);
1895 inline void emit_rex_64(XMMRegister reg, Operand op);
1896
1897 // Emits a REX prefix that encodes a 64-bit operand size and
1898 // the top bit of the register code.
1899 // The high bit of register is used for REX.B.
1900 // REX.W is set and REX.R and REX.X are clear.
1901 inline void emit_rex_64(Register rm_reg);
1902
1903 // Emits a REX prefix that encodes a 64-bit operand size and
1904 // the top bit of the index and base register codes.
1905 // The high bit of op's base register is used for REX.B, and the high
1906 // bit of op's index register is used for REX.X.
1907 // REX.W is set and REX.R clear.
1908 inline void emit_rex_64(Operand op);
1909
1910 // Emit a REX prefix that only sets REX.W to choose a 64-bit operand size.
1911 void emit_rex_64() { emit(0x48); }
1912
1913 // High bit of reg goes to REX.R, high bit of rm_reg goes to REX.B.
1914 // REX.W is clear.
1915 inline void emit_rex_32(Register reg, Register rm_reg);
1916
1917 // The high bit of reg is used for REX.R, the high bit of op's base
1918 // register is used for REX.B, and the high bit of op's index register
1919 // is used for REX.X. REX.W is cleared.
1920 inline void emit_rex_32(Register reg, Operand op);
1921
1922 // High bit of rm_reg goes to REX.B.
1923 // REX.W, REX.R and REX.X are clear.
1924 inline void emit_rex_32(Register rm_reg);
1925
1926 // High bit of base goes to REX.B and high bit of index to REX.X.
1927 // REX.W and REX.R are clear.
1928 inline void emit_rex_32(Operand op);
1929
1930 // High bit of reg goes to REX.R, high bit of rm_reg goes to REX.B.
1931 // REX.W is cleared. If no REX bits are set, no byte is emitted.
1932 inline void emit_optional_rex_32(Register reg, Register rm_reg);
1933
1934 // The high bit of reg is used for REX.R, the high bit of op's base
1935 // register is used for REX.B, and the high bit of op's index register
1936 // is used for REX.X. REX.W is cleared. If no REX bits are set, nothing
1937 // is emitted.
1938 inline void emit_optional_rex_32(Register reg, Operand op);
1939
1940 // As for emit_optional_rex_32(Register, Register), except that
1941 // the registers are XMM registers.
1942 inline void emit_optional_rex_32(XMMRegister reg, XMMRegister base);
1943
1944 // As for emit_optional_rex_32(Register, Register), except that
1945 // one of the registers is an XMM registers.
1946 inline void emit_optional_rex_32(XMMRegister reg, Register base);
1947
1948 // As for emit_optional_rex_32(Register, Register), except that
1949 // one of the registers is an XMM registers.
1950 inline void emit_optional_rex_32(Register reg, XMMRegister base);
1951
1952 // As for emit_optional_rex_32(Register, Operand), except that
1953 // the register is an XMM register.
1954 inline void emit_optional_rex_32(XMMRegister reg, Operand op);
1955
1956 // Optionally do as emit_rex_32(Register) if the register number has
1957 // the high bit set.
1958 inline void emit_optional_rex_32(Register rm_reg);
1959 inline void emit_optional_rex_32(XMMRegister rm_reg);
1960
1961 // Optionally do as emit_rex_32(Operand) if the operand register
1962 // numbers have a high bit set.
1963 inline void emit_optional_rex_32(Operand op);
1964
1965 // Calls emit_rex_32(Register) for all non-byte registers.
1966 inline void emit_optional_rex_8(Register reg);
1967
1968 // Calls emit_rex_32(Register, Operand) for all non-byte registers, and
1969 // emit_optional_rex_32(Register, Operand) for byte registers.
1970 inline void emit_optional_rex_8(Register reg, Operand op);
1971
1972 void emit_rex(int size) {
1973 if (size == kInt64Size) {
1974 emit_rex_64();
1975 } else {
1976 DCHECK_EQ(size, kInt32Size)((void) 0);
1977 }
1978 }
1979
1980 template <class P1>
1981 void emit_rex(P1 p1, int size) {
1982 if (size == kInt64Size) {
1983 emit_rex_64(p1);
1984 } else {
1985 DCHECK_EQ(size, kInt32Size)((void) 0);
1986 emit_optional_rex_32(p1);
1987 }
1988 }
1989
1990 template <class P1, class P2>
1991 void emit_rex(P1 p1, P2 p2, int size) {
1992 if (size == kInt64Size) {
1993 emit_rex_64(p1, p2);
1994 } else {
1995 DCHECK_EQ(size, kInt32Size)((void) 0);
1996 emit_optional_rex_32(p1, p2);
1997 }
1998 }
1999
2000 // Emit vex prefix
2001 void emit_vex2_byte0() { emit(0xc5); }
2002 inline void emit_vex2_byte1(XMMRegister reg, XMMRegister v, VectorLength l,
2003 SIMDPrefix pp);
2004 void emit_vex3_byte0() { emit(0xc4); }
2005 inline void emit_vex3_byte1(XMMRegister reg, XMMRegister rm, LeadingOpcode m);
2006 inline void emit_vex3_byte1(XMMRegister reg, Operand rm, LeadingOpcode m);
2007 inline void emit_vex3_byte2(VexW w, XMMRegister v, VectorLength l,
2008 SIMDPrefix pp);
2009 inline void emit_vex_prefix(XMMRegister reg, XMMRegister v, XMMRegister rm,
2010 VectorLength l, SIMDPrefix pp, LeadingOpcode m,
2011 VexW w);
2012 inline void emit_vex_prefix(Register reg, Register v, Register rm,
2013 VectorLength l, SIMDPrefix pp, LeadingOpcode m,
2014 VexW w);
2015 inline void emit_vex_prefix(XMMRegister reg, XMMRegister v, Operand rm,
2016 VectorLength l, SIMDPrefix pp, LeadingOpcode m,
2017 VexW w);
2018 inline void emit_vex_prefix(Register reg, Register v, Operand rm,
2019 VectorLength l, SIMDPrefix pp, LeadingOpcode m,
2020 VexW w);
2021
2022 // Emit the ModR/M byte, and optionally the SIB byte and
2023 // 1- or 4-byte offset for a memory operand. Also encodes
2024 // the second operand of the operation, a register or operation
2025 // subcode, into the reg field of the ModR/M byte.
2026 void emit_operand(Register reg, Operand adr) {
2027 emit_operand(reg.low_bits(), adr);
2028 }
2029
2030 // Emit the ModR/M byte, and optionally the SIB byte and
2031 // 1- or 4-byte offset for a memory operand. Also used to encode
2032 // a three-bit opcode extension into the ModR/M byte.
2033 void emit_operand(int rm, Operand adr);
2034
2035 // Emit a ModR/M byte with registers coded in the reg and rm_reg fields.
2036 void emit_modrm(Register reg, Register rm_reg) {
2037 emit(0xC0 | reg.low_bits() << 3 | rm_reg.low_bits());
2038 }
2039
2040 // Emit a ModR/M byte with an operation subcode in the reg field and
2041 // a register in the rm_reg field.
2042 void emit_modrm(int code, Register rm_reg) {
2043 DCHECK(is_uint3(code))((void) 0);
2044 emit(0xC0 | code << 3 | rm_reg.low_bits());
2045 }
2046
2047 // Emit the code-object-relative offset of the label's position
2048 inline void emit_code_relative_offset(Label* label);
2049
2050 // The first argument is the reg field, the second argument is the r/m field.
2051 void emit_sse_operand(XMMRegister dst, XMMRegister src);
2052 void emit_sse_operand(XMMRegister reg, Operand adr);
2053 void emit_sse_operand(Register reg, Operand adr);
2054 void emit_sse_operand(XMMRegister dst, Register src);
2055 void emit_sse_operand(Register dst, XMMRegister src);
2056 void emit_sse_operand(XMMRegister dst);
2057
2058 // Emit machine code for one of the operations ADD, ADC, SUB, SBC,
2059 // AND, OR, XOR, or CMP. The encodings of these operations are all
2060 // similar, differing just in the opcode or in the reg field of the
2061 // ModR/M byte.
2062 void arithmetic_op_8(byte opcode, Register reg, Register rm_reg);
2063 void arithmetic_op_8(byte opcode, Register reg, Operand rm_reg);
2064 void arithmetic_op_16(byte opcode, Register reg, Register rm_reg);
2065 void arithmetic_op_16(byte opcode, Register reg, Operand rm_reg);
2066 // Operate on operands/registers with pointer size, 32-bit or 64-bit size.
2067 void arithmetic_op(byte opcode, Register reg, Register rm_reg, int size);
2068 void arithmetic_op(byte opcode, Register reg, Operand rm_reg, int size);
2069 // Operate on a byte in memory or register.
2070 void immediate_arithmetic_op_8(byte subcode, Register dst, Immediate src);
2071 void immediate_arithmetic_op_8(byte subcode, Operand dst, Immediate src);
2072 // Operate on a word in memory or register.
2073 void immediate_arithmetic_op_16(byte subcode, Register dst, Immediate src);
2074 void immediate_arithmetic_op_16(byte subcode, Operand dst, Immediate src);
2075 // Operate on operands/registers with pointer size, 32-bit or 64-bit size.
2076 void immediate_arithmetic_op(byte subcode, Register dst, Immediate src,
2077 int size);
2078 void immediate_arithmetic_op(byte subcode, Operand dst, Immediate src,
2079 int size);
2080
2081 // Emit machine code for a shift operation.
2082 void shift(Operand dst, Immediate shift_amount, int subcode, int size);
2083 void shift(Register dst, Immediate shift_amount, int subcode, int size);
2084 // Shift dst by cl % 64 bits.
2085 void shift(Register dst, int subcode, int size);
2086 void shift(Operand dst, int subcode, int size);
2087
2088 void emit_farith(int b1, int b2, int i);
2089
2090 // labels
2091 // void print(Label* L);
2092 void bind_to(Label* L, int pos);
2093
2094 // record reloc info for current pc_
2095 void RecordRelocInfo(RelocInfo::Mode rmode, intptr_t data = 0);
2096
2097 // Arithmetics
2098 void emit_add(Register dst, Register src, int size) {
2099 arithmetic_op(0x03, dst, src, size);
2100 }
2101
2102 void emit_add(Register dst, Immediate src, int size) {
2103 immediate_arithmetic_op(0x0, dst, src, size);
2104 }
2105
2106 void emit_add(Register dst, Operand src, int size) {
2107 arithmetic_op(0x03, dst, src, size);
2108 }
2109
2110 void emit_add(Operand dst, Register src, int size) {
2111 arithmetic_op(0x1, src, dst, size);
2112 }
2113
2114 void emit_add(Operand dst, Immediate src, int size) {
2115 immediate_arithmetic_op(0x0, dst, src, size);
2116 }
2117
2118 void emit_and(Register dst, Register src, int size) {
2119 arithmetic_op(0x23, dst, src, size);
2120 }
2121
2122 void emit_and(Register dst, Operand src, int size) {
2123 arithmetic_op(0x23, dst, src, size);
2124 }
2125
2126 void emit_and(Operand dst, Register src, int size) {
2127 arithmetic_op(0x21, src, dst, size);
2128 }
2129
2130 void emit_and(Register dst, Immediate src, int size) {
2131 immediate_arithmetic_op(0x4, dst, src, size);
2132 }
2133
2134 void emit_and(Operand dst, Immediate src, int size) {
2135 immediate_arithmetic_op(0x4, dst, src, size);
2136 }
2137
2138 void emit_cmp(Register dst, Register src, int size) {
2139 arithmetic_op(0x3B, dst, src, size);
2140 }
2141
2142 void emit_cmp(Register dst, Operand src, int size) {
2143 arithmetic_op(0x3B, dst, src, size);
2144 }
2145
2146 void emit_cmp(Operand dst, Register src, int size) {
2147 arithmetic_op(0x39, src, dst, size);
2148 }
2149
2150 void emit_cmp(Register dst, Immediate src, int size) {
2151 immediate_arithmetic_op(0x7, dst, src, size);
2152 }
2153
2154 void emit_cmp(Operand dst, Immediate src, int size) {
2155 immediate_arithmetic_op(0x7, dst, src, size);
2156 }
2157
2158 // Compare {al,ax,eax,rax} with src. If equal, set ZF and write dst into
2159 // src. Otherwise clear ZF and write src into {al,ax,eax,rax}. This
2160 // operation is only atomic if prefixed by the lock instruction.
2161 void emit_cmpxchg(Operand dst, Register src, int size);
2162
2163 void emit_dec(Register dst, int size);
2164 void emit_dec(Operand dst, int size);
2165
2166 // Divide rdx:rax by src. Quotient in rax, remainder in rdx when size is 64.
2167 // Divide edx:eax by lower 32 bits of src. Quotient in eax, remainder in edx
2168 // when size is 32.
2169 void emit_idiv(Register src, int size);
2170 void emit_div(Register src, int size);
2171
2172 // Signed multiply instructions.
2173 // rdx:rax = rax * src when size is 64 or edx:eax = eax * src when size is 32.
2174 void emit_imul(Register src, int size);
2175 void emit_imul(Operand src, int size);
2176 void emit_imul(Register dst, Register src, int size);
2177 void emit_imul(Register dst, Operand src, int size);
2178 void emit_imul(Register dst, Register src, Immediate imm, int size);
2179 void emit_imul(Register dst, Operand src, Immediate imm, int size);
2180
2181 void emit_inc(Register dst, int size);
2182 void emit_inc(Operand dst, int size);
2183
2184 void emit_lea(Register dst, Operand src, int size);
2185
2186 void emit_mov(Register dst, Operand src, int size);
2187 void emit_mov(Register dst, Register src, int size);
2188 void emit_mov(Operand dst, Register src, int size);
2189 void emit_mov(Register dst, Immediate value, int size);
2190 void emit_mov(Operand dst, Immediate value, int size);
2191 void emit_mov(Register dst, Immediate64 value, int size);
2192
2193 void emit_movzxb(Register dst, Operand src, int size);
2194 void emit_movzxb(Register dst, Register src, int size);
2195 void emit_movzxw(Register dst, Operand src, int size);
2196 void emit_movzxw(Register dst, Register src, int size);
2197
2198 void emit_neg(Register dst, int size);
2199 void emit_neg(Operand dst, int size);
2200
2201 void emit_not(Register dst, int size);
2202 void emit_not(Operand dst, int size);
2203
2204 void emit_or(Register dst, Register src, int size) {
2205 arithmetic_op(0x0B, dst, src, size);
2206 }
2207
2208 void emit_or(Register dst, Operand src, int size) {
2209 arithmetic_op(0x0B, dst, src, size);
2210 }
2211
2212 void emit_or(Operand dst, Register src, int size) {
2213 arithmetic_op(0x9, src, dst, size);
2214 }
2215
2216 void emit_or(Register dst, Immediate src, int size) {
2217 immediate_arithmetic_op(0x1, dst, src, size);
2218 }
2219
2220 void emit_or(Operand dst, Immediate src, int size) {
2221 immediate_arithmetic_op(0x1, dst, src, size);
2222 }
2223
2224 void emit_repmovs(int size);
2225
2226 void emit_sbb(Register dst, Register src, int size) {
2227 arithmetic_op(0x1b, dst, src, size);
2228 }
2229
2230 void emit_sub(Register dst, Register src, int size) {
2231 arithmetic_op(0x2B, dst, src, size);
2232 }
2233
2234 void emit_sub(Register dst, Immediate src, int size) {
2235 immediate_arithmetic_op(0x5, dst, src, size);
2236 }
2237
2238 void emit_sub(Register dst, Operand src, int size) {
2239 arithmetic_op(0x2B, dst, src, size);
2240 }
2241
2242 void emit_sub(Operand dst, Register src, int size) {
2243 arithmetic_op(0x29, src, dst, size);
2244 }
2245
2246 void emit_sub(Operand dst, Immediate src, int size) {
2247 immediate_arithmetic_op(0x5, dst, src, size);
2248 }
2249
2250 void emit_test(Register dst, Register src, int size);
2251 void emit_test(Register reg, Immediate mask, int size);
2252 void emit_test(Operand op, Register reg, int size);
2253 void emit_test(Operand op, Immediate mask, int size);
2254 void emit_test(Register reg, Operand op, int size) {
2255 return emit_test(op, reg, size);
2256 }
2257
2258 void emit_xchg(Register dst, Register src, int size);
2259 void emit_xchg(Register dst, Operand src, int size);
2260
2261 void emit_xor(Register dst, Register src, int size) {
2262 if (size == kInt64Size && dst.code() == src.code()) {
2263 // 32 bit operations zero the top 32 bits of 64 bit registers. Therefore
2264 // there is no need to make this a 64 bit operation.
2265 arithmetic_op(0x33, dst, src, kInt32Size);
2266 } else {
2267 arithmetic_op(0x33, dst, src, size);
2268 }
2269 }
2270
2271 void emit_xor(Register dst, Operand src, int size) {
2272 arithmetic_op(0x33, dst, src, size);
2273 }
2274
2275 void emit_xor(Register dst, Immediate src, int size) {
2276 immediate_arithmetic_op(0x6, dst, src, size);
2277 }
2278
2279 void emit_xor(Operand dst, Immediate src, int size) {
2280 immediate_arithmetic_op(0x6, dst, src, size);
2281 }
2282
2283 void emit_xor(Operand dst, Register src, int size) {
2284 arithmetic_op(0x31, src, dst, size);
2285 }
2286
2287 // Most BMI instructions are similar.
2288 void bmi1q(byte op, Register reg, Register vreg, Register rm);
2289 void bmi1q(byte op, Register reg, Register vreg, Operand rm);
2290 void bmi1l(byte op, Register reg, Register vreg, Register rm);
2291 void bmi1l(byte op, Register reg, Register vreg, Operand rm);
2292 void bmi2q(SIMDPrefix pp, byte op, Register reg, Register vreg, Register rm);
2293 void bmi2q(SIMDPrefix pp, byte op, Register reg, Register vreg, Operand rm);
2294 void bmi2l(SIMDPrefix pp, byte op, Register reg, Register vreg, Register rm);
2295 void bmi2l(SIMDPrefix pp, byte op, Register reg, Register vreg, Operand rm);
2296
2297 // record the position of jmp/jcc instruction
2298 void record_farjmp_position(Label* L, int pos);
2299
2300 bool is_optimizable_farjmp(int idx);
2301
2302 void AllocateAndInstallRequestedHeapObjects(Isolate* isolate);
2303
2304 int WriteCodeComments();
2305
2306 friend class EnsureSpace;
2307 friend class RegExpMacroAssemblerX64;
2308
2309 // code generation
2310 RelocInfoWriter reloc_info_writer;
2311
2312 // Internal reference positions, required for (potential) patching in
2313 // GrowBuffer(); contains only those internal references whose labels
2314 // are already bound.
2315 std::deque<int> internal_reference_positions_;
2316
2317 // Variables for this instance of assembler
2318 int farjmp_num_ = 0;
2319 std::deque<int> farjmp_positions_;
2320 std::map<Label*, std::vector<int>> label_farjmp_maps_;
2321
2322 ConstPool constpool_;
2323
2324 friend class ConstPool;
2325
2326#if defined(V8_OS_WIN_X64)
2327 std::unique_ptr<win64_unwindinfo::XdataEncoder> xdata_encoder_;
2328#endif
2329};
2330
2331// Helper class that ensures that there is enough space for generating
2332// instructions and relocation information. The constructor makes
2333// sure that there is enough space and (in debug mode) the destructor
2334// checks that we did not generate too much.
2335class EnsureSpace {
2336 public:
2337 explicit EnsureSpace(Assembler* assembler) : assembler_(assembler) {
2338 if (assembler_->buffer_overflow()) assembler_->GrowBuffer();
2339#ifdef DEBUG
2340 space_before_ = assembler_->available_space();
2341#endif
2342 }
2343
2344#ifdef DEBUG
2345 ~EnsureSpace() {
2346 int bytes_generated = space_before_ - assembler_->available_space();
2347 DCHECK(bytes_generated < assembler_->kGap)((void) 0);
2348 }
2349#endif
2350
2351 private:
2352 Assembler* assembler_;
2353#ifdef DEBUG
2354 int space_before_;
2355#endif
2356};
2357
2358} // namespace internal
2359} // namespace v8
2360
2361#endif // V8_CODEGEN_X64_ASSEMBLER_X64_H_
←

../deps/v8/src/wasm/baseline/liftoff-assembler.cc

→
1// Copyright 2017 the V8 project authors. All rights reserved.
2// Use of this source code is governed by a BSD-style license that can be
3// found in the LICENSE file.
4
5#include "src/wasm/baseline/liftoff-assembler.h"
6
7#include <sstream>
8
9#include "src/base/optional.h"
10#include "src/codegen/assembler-inl.h"
11#include "src/codegen/macro-assembler-inl.h"
12#include "src/compiler/linkage.h"
13#include "src/compiler/wasm-compiler.h"
14#include "src/utils/ostreams.h"
15#include "src/wasm/baseline/liftoff-register.h"
16#include "src/wasm/function-body-decoder-impl.h"
17#include "src/wasm/wasm-linkage.h"
18#include "src/wasm/wasm-opcodes.h"
19
20namespace v8 {
21namespace internal {
22namespace wasm {
23
24using VarState = LiftoffAssembler::VarState;
25
26constexpr ValueType LiftoffAssembler::kWasmIntPtr;
27
28namespace {
29
30class StackTransferRecipe {
31 struct RegisterMove {
32 LiftoffRegister src;
33 ValueType type;
34 constexpr RegisterMove(LiftoffRegister src, ValueType type)
35 : src(src), type(type) {}
36 };
37
38 struct RegisterLoad {
39 enum LoadKind : uint8_t {
40 kConstant, // load a constant value into a register.
41 kStack, // fill a register from a stack slot.
42 kLowHalfStack, // fill a register from the low half of a stack slot.
43 kHighHalfStack // fill a register from the high half of a stack slot.
44 };
45
46 LoadKind kind;
47 ValueType type;
48 int32_t value; // i32 constant value or stack offset, depending on kind.
49
50 // Named constructors.
51 static RegisterLoad Const(WasmValue constant) {
52 if (constant.type() == kWasmI32) {
53 return {kConstant, kWasmI32, constant.to_i32()};
54 }
55 DCHECK_EQ(kWasmI64, constant.type())((void) 0);
56 DCHECK_EQ(constant.to_i32_unchecked(), constant.to_i64_unchecked())((void) 0);
57 return {kConstant, kWasmI64, constant.to_i32_unchecked()};
58 }
59 static RegisterLoad Stack(int32_t offset, ValueType type) {
60 return {kStack, type, offset};
61 }
62 static RegisterLoad HalfStack(int32_t offset, RegPairHalf half) {
63 return {half == kLowWord ? kLowHalfStack : kHighHalfStack, kWasmI32,
64 offset};
65 }
66
67 private:
68 RegisterLoad(LoadKind kind, ValueType type, int32_t value)
69 : kind(kind), type(type), value(value) {}
70 };
71
72 public:
73 explicit StackTransferRecipe(LiftoffAssembler* wasm_asm) : asm_(wasm_asm) {}
74 ~StackTransferRecipe() { Execute(); }
75
76 void Execute() {
77 // First, execute register moves. Then load constants and stack values into
78 // registers.
79 ExecuteMoves();
80 DCHECK(move_dst_regs_.is_empty())((void) 0);
81 ExecuteLoads();
82 DCHECK(load_dst_regs_.is_empty())((void) 0);
83 }
84
85 V8_INLINEinline __attribute__((always_inline)) void TransferStackSlot(const VarState& dst, const VarState& src) {
86 DCHECK_EQ(dst.type(), src.type())((void) 0);
87 if (dst.is_reg()) {
88 LoadIntoRegister(dst.reg(), src, src.offset());
89 return;
90 }
91 if (dst.is_const()) {
92 DCHECK_EQ(dst.i32_const(), src.i32_const())((void) 0);
93 return;
94 }
95 DCHECK(dst.is_stack())((void) 0);
96 switch (src.loc()) {
97 case VarState::kStack:
98 if (src.offset() != dst.offset()) {
99 asm_->MoveStackValue(dst.offset(), src.offset(), src.type());
100 }
101 break;
102 case VarState::kRegister:
103 asm_->Spill(dst.offset(), src.reg(), src.type());
104 break;
105 case VarState::kIntConst:
106 asm_->Spill(dst.offset(), src.constant());
107 break;
108 }
109 }
110
111 V8_INLINEinline __attribute__((always_inline)) void LoadIntoRegister(LiftoffRegister dst,
112 const LiftoffAssembler::VarState& src,
113 uint32_t src_offset) {
114 switch (src.loc()) {
115 case VarState::kStack:
116 LoadStackSlot(dst, src_offset, src.type());
117 break;
118 case VarState::kRegister:
119 DCHECK_EQ(dst.reg_class(), src.reg_class())((void) 0);
120 if (dst != src.reg()) MoveRegister(dst, src.reg(), src.type());
121 break;
122 case VarState::kIntConst:
123 LoadConstant(dst, src.constant());
124 break;
125 }
126 }
127
128 void LoadI64HalfIntoRegister(LiftoffRegister dst,
129 const LiftoffAssembler::VarState& src,
130 int offset, RegPairHalf half) {
131 // Use CHECK such that the remaining code is statically dead if
132 // {kNeedI64RegPair} is false.
133 CHECK(kNeedI64RegPair)do { if ((__builtin_expect(!!(!(kNeedI64RegPair)), 0))) { V8_Fatal
("Check failed: %s.", "kNeedI64RegPair"); } } while (false);
134 DCHECK_EQ(kWasmI64, src.type())((void) 0);
135 switch (src.loc()) {
136 case VarState::kStack:
137 LoadI64HalfStackSlot(dst, offset, half);
138 break;
139 case VarState::kRegister: {
140 LiftoffRegister src_half =
141 half == kLowWord ? src.reg().low() : src.reg().high();
142 if (dst != src_half) MoveRegister(dst, src_half, kWasmI32);
143 break;
144 }
145 case VarState::kIntConst:
146 int32_t value = src.i32_const();
147 // The high word is the sign extension of the low word.
148 if (half == kHighWord) value = value >> 31;
149 LoadConstant(dst, WasmValue(value));
150 break;
151 }
152 }
153
154 void MoveRegister(LiftoffRegister dst, LiftoffRegister src, ValueType type) {
155 DCHECK_NE(dst, src)((void) 0);
156 DCHECK_EQ(dst.reg_class(), src.reg_class())((void) 0);
157 DCHECK_EQ(reg_class_for(type), src.reg_class())((void) 0);
158 if (src.is_gp_pair()) {
159 DCHECK_EQ(kWasmI64, type)((void) 0);
160 if (dst.low() != src.low()) MoveRegister(dst.low(), src.low(), kWasmI32);
161 if (dst.high() != src.high())
162 MoveRegister(dst.high(), src.high(), kWasmI32);
163 return;
164 }
165 if (src.is_fp_pair()) {
166 DCHECK_EQ(kWasmS128, type)((void) 0);
167 if (dst.low() != src.low()) {
168 MoveRegister(dst.low(), src.low(), kWasmF64);
169 MoveRegister(dst.high(), src.high(), kWasmF64);
170 }
171 return;
172 }
173 if (move_dst_regs_.has(dst)) {
174 DCHECK_EQ(register_move(dst)->src, src)((void) 0);
175 // Non-fp registers can only occur with the exact same type.
176 DCHECK_IMPLIES(!dst.is_fp(), register_move(dst)->type == type)((void) 0);
177 // It can happen that one fp register holds both the f32 zero and the f64
178 // zero, as the initial value for local variables. Move the value as f64
179 // in that case.
180 if (type == kWasmF64) register_move(dst)->type = kWasmF64;
181 return;
182 }
183 move_dst_regs_.set(dst);
184 ++*src_reg_use_count(src);
185 *register_move(dst) = {src, type};
186 }
187
188 void LoadConstant(LiftoffRegister dst, WasmValue value) {
189 DCHECK(!load_dst_regs_.has(dst))((void) 0);
190 load_dst_regs_.set(dst);
191 if (dst.is_gp_pair()) {
192 DCHECK_EQ(kWasmI64, value.type())((void) 0);
193 int64_t i64 = value.to_i64();
194 *register_load(dst.low()) =
195 RegisterLoad::Const(WasmValue(static_cast<int32_t>(i64)));
196 *register_load(dst.high()) =
197 RegisterLoad::Const(WasmValue(static_cast<int32_t>(i64 >> 32)));
198 } else {
199 *register_load(dst) = RegisterLoad::Const(value);
200 }
201 }
202
203 void LoadStackSlot(LiftoffRegister dst, uint32_t stack_offset,
204 ValueType type) {
205 if (load_dst_regs_.has(dst)) {
206 // It can happen that we spilled the same register to different stack
207 // slots, and then we reload them later into the same dst register.
208 // In that case, it is enough to load one of the stack slots.
209 return;
210 }
211 load_dst_regs_.set(dst);
212 if (dst.is_gp_pair()) {
213 DCHECK_EQ(kWasmI64, type)((void) 0);
214 *register_load(dst.low()) =
215 RegisterLoad::HalfStack(stack_offset, kLowWord);
216 *register_load(dst.high()) =
217 RegisterLoad::HalfStack(stack_offset, kHighWord);
218 } else if (dst.is_fp_pair()) {
219 DCHECK_EQ(kWasmS128, type)((void) 0);
220 // load_dst_regs_.set above will set both low and high fp regs.
221 // But unlike gp_pair, we load a kWasm128 in one go in ExecuteLoads.
222 // So unset the top fp register to skip loading it.
223 load_dst_regs_.clear(dst.high());
224 *register_load(dst.low()) = RegisterLoad::Stack(stack_offset, type);
225 } else {
226 *register_load(dst) = RegisterLoad::Stack(stack_offset, type);
227 }
228 }
229
230 void LoadI64HalfStackSlot(LiftoffRegister dst, int offset, RegPairHalf half) {
231 if (load_dst_regs_.has(dst)) {
232 // It can happen that we spilled the same register to different stack
233 // slots, and then we reload them later into the same dst register.
234 // In that case, it is enough to load one of the stack slots.
235 return;
236 }
237 load_dst_regs_.set(dst);
238 *register_load(dst) = RegisterLoad::HalfStack(offset, half);
239 }
240
241 private:
242 using MovesStorage =
243 std::aligned_storage<kAfterMaxLiftoffRegCode * sizeof(RegisterMove),
244 alignof(RegisterMove)>::type;
245 using LoadsStorage =
246 std::aligned_storage<kAfterMaxLiftoffRegCode * sizeof(RegisterLoad),
247 alignof(RegisterLoad)>::type;
248
249 ASSERT_TRIVIALLY_COPYABLE(RegisterMove)static_assert(::v8::base::is_trivially_copyable<RegisterMove
>::value, "RegisterMove" " should be trivially copyable");
250 ASSERT_TRIVIALLY_COPYABLE(RegisterLoad)static_assert(::v8::base::is_trivially_copyable<RegisterLoad
>::value, "RegisterLoad" " should be trivially copyable");
251
252 MovesStorage register_moves_; // uninitialized
253 LoadsStorage register_loads_; // uninitialized
254 int src_reg_use_count_[kAfterMaxLiftoffRegCode] = {0};
255 LiftoffRegList move_dst_regs_;
256 LiftoffRegList load_dst_regs_;
257 LiftoffAssembler* const asm_;
258
259 RegisterMove* register_move(LiftoffRegister reg) {
260 return reinterpret_cast<RegisterMove*>(&register_moves_) +
261 reg.liftoff_code();
262 }
263 RegisterLoad* register_load(LiftoffRegister reg) {
264 return reinterpret_cast<RegisterLoad*>(&register_loads_) +
265 reg.liftoff_code();
266 }
267 int* src_reg_use_count(LiftoffRegister reg) {
268 return src_reg_use_count_ + reg.liftoff_code();
269 }
270
271 void ExecuteMove(LiftoffRegister dst) {
272 RegisterMove* move = register_move(dst);
273 DCHECK_EQ(0, *src_reg_use_count(dst))((void) 0);
274 asm_->Move(dst, move->src, move->type);
275 ClearExecutedMove(dst);
276 }
277
278 void ClearExecutedMove(LiftoffRegister dst) {
279 DCHECK(move_dst_regs_.has(dst))((void) 0);
280 move_dst_regs_.clear(dst);
281 RegisterMove* move = register_move(dst);
282 DCHECK_LT(0, *src_reg_use_count(move->src))((void) 0);
283 if (--*src_reg_use_count(move->src)) return;
284 // src count dropped to zero. If this is a destination register, execute
285 // that move now.
286 if (!move_dst_regs_.has(move->src)) return;
287 ExecuteMove(move->src);
288 }
289
290 void ExecuteMoves() {
291 // Execute all moves whose {dst} is not being used as src in another move.
292 // If any src count drops to zero, also (transitively) execute the
293 // corresponding move to that register.
294 for (LiftoffRegister dst : move_dst_regs_) {
295 // Check if already handled via transitivity in {ClearExecutedMove}.
296 if (!move_dst_regs_.has(dst)) continue;
297 if (*src_reg_use_count(dst)) continue;
298 ExecuteMove(dst);
299 }
300
301 // All remaining moves are parts of a cycle. Just spill the first one, then
302 // process all remaining moves in that cycle. Repeat for all cycles.
303 int last_spill_offset = asm_->TopSpillOffset();
304 while (!move_dst_regs_.is_empty()) {
305 // TODO(clemensb): Use an unused register if available.
306 LiftoffRegister dst = move_dst_regs_.GetFirstRegSet();
307 RegisterMove* move = register_move(dst);
308 last_spill_offset += LiftoffAssembler::SlotSizeForType(move->type);
309 LiftoffRegister spill_reg = move->src;
310 asm_->Spill(last_spill_offset, spill_reg, move->type);
311 // Remember to reload into the destination register later.
312 LoadStackSlot(dst, last_spill_offset, move->type);
313 ClearExecutedMove(dst);
314 }
315 }
316
317 void ExecuteLoads() {
318 for (LiftoffRegister dst : load_dst_regs_) {
319 RegisterLoad* load = register_load(dst);
320 switch (load->kind) {
321 case RegisterLoad::kConstant:
322 asm_->LoadConstant(dst, load->type == kWasmI64
323 ? WasmValue(int64_t{load->value})
324 : WasmValue(int32_t{load->value}));
325 break;
326 case RegisterLoad::kStack:
327 if (kNeedS128RegPair && load->type == kWasmS128) {
328 asm_->Fill(LiftoffRegister::ForFpPair(dst.fp()), load->value,
329 load->type);
330 } else {
331 asm_->Fill(dst, load->value, load->type);
332 }
333 break;
334 case RegisterLoad::kLowHalfStack:
335 // Half of a register pair, {dst} must be a gp register.
336 asm_->FillI64Half(dst.gp(), load->value, kLowWord);
337 break;
338 case RegisterLoad::kHighHalfStack:
339 // Half of a register pair, {dst} must be a gp register.
340 asm_->FillI64Half(dst.gp(), load->value, kHighWord);
341 break;
342 }
343 }
344 load_dst_regs_ = {};
345 }
346
347 DISALLOW_COPY_AND_ASSIGN(StackTransferRecipe)StackTransferRecipe(const StackTransferRecipe&) = delete;
StackTransferRecipe& operator=(const StackTransferRecipe
&) = delete;
348};
349
350class RegisterReuseMap {
351 public:
352 void Add(LiftoffRegister src, LiftoffRegister dst) {
353 if (auto previous = Lookup(src)) {
354 DCHECK_EQ(previous, dst)((void) 0);
355 return;
356 }
357 map_.emplace_back(src);
358 map_.emplace_back(dst);
359 }
360
361 base::Optional<LiftoffRegister> Lookup(LiftoffRegister src) {
362 for (auto it = map_.begin(), end = map_.end(); it != end; it += 2) {
363 if (it->is_gp_pair() == src.is_gp_pair() &&
364 it->is_fp_pair() == src.is_fp_pair() && *it == src)
365 return *(it + 1);
366 }
367 return {};
368 }
369
370 private:
371 // {map_} holds pairs of <src, dst>.
372 base::SmallVector<LiftoffRegister, 8> map_;
373};
374
375enum MergeKeepStackSlots : bool {
376 kKeepStackSlots = true,
377 kTurnStackSlotsIntoRegisters = false
378};
379enum MergeAllowConstants : bool {
380 kConstantsAllowed = true,
381 kConstantsNotAllowed = false
382};
383enum ReuseRegisters : bool {
384 kReuseRegisters = true,
385 kNoReuseRegisters = false
386};
387void InitMergeRegion(LiftoffAssembler::CacheState* state,
388 const VarState* source, VarState* target, uint32_t count,
389 MergeKeepStackSlots keep_stack_slots,
390 MergeAllowConstants allow_constants,
391 ReuseRegisters reuse_registers, LiftoffRegList used_regs) {
392 RegisterReuseMap register_reuse_map;
393 for (const VarState* source_end = source + count; source < source_end;
394 ++source, ++target) {
395 if ((source->is_stack() && keep_stack_slots) ||
396 (source->is_const() && allow_constants)) {
397 *target = *source;
398 continue;
399 }
400 base::Optional<LiftoffRegister> reg;
401 // First try: Keep the same register, if it's free.
402 if (source->is_reg() && state->is_free(source->reg())) {
403 reg = source->reg();
404 }
405 // Second try: Use the same register we used before (if we reuse registers).
406 if (!reg && reuse_registers) {
407 reg = register_reuse_map.Lookup(source->reg());
408 }
409 // Third try: Use any free register.
410 RegClass rc = reg_class_for(source->type());
411 if (!reg && state->has_unused_register(rc, used_regs)) {
412 reg = state->unused_register(rc, used_regs);
413 }
414 if (!reg) {
415 // No free register; make this a stack slot.
416 *target = VarState(source->type(), source->offset());
417 continue;
418 }
419 if (reuse_registers) register_reuse_map.Add(source->reg(), *reg);
420 state->inc_used(*reg);
421 *target = VarState(source->type(), *reg, source->offset());
422 }
423}
424
425} // namespace
426
427// TODO(clemensb): Don't copy the full parent state (this makes us N^2).
428void LiftoffAssembler::CacheState::InitMerge(const CacheState& source,
429 uint32_t num_locals,
430 uint32_t arity,
431 uint32_t stack_depth) {
432 // |------locals------|---(in between)----|--(discarded)--|----merge----|
433 // <-- num_locals --> <-- stack_depth -->^stack_base <-- arity -->
434
435 uint32_t stack_base = stack_depth + num_locals;
436 uint32_t target_height = stack_base + arity;
437 uint32_t discarded = source.stack_height() - target_height;
438 DCHECK(stack_state.empty())((void) 0);
439
440 DCHECK_GE(source.stack_height(), stack_base)((void) 0);
441 stack_state.resize_no_init(target_height);
442
443 const VarState* source_begin = source.stack_state.data();
444 VarState* target_begin = stack_state.data();
445
446 // Try to keep locals and the merge region in their registers. Register used
447 // multiple times need to be copied to another free register. Compute the list
448 // of used registers.
449 LiftoffRegList used_regs;
450 for (auto& src : VectorOf(source_begin, num_locals)) {
451 if (src.is_reg()) used_regs.set(src.reg());
452 }
453 for (auto& src : VectorOf(source_begin + stack_base + discarded, arity)) {
454 if (src.is_reg()) used_regs.set(src.reg());
455 }
456
457 // Initialize the merge region. If this region moves, try to turn stack slots
458 // into registers since we need to load the value anyways.
459 MergeKeepStackSlots keep_merge_stack_slots =
460 discarded == 0 ? kKeepStackSlots : kTurnStackSlotsIntoRegisters;
461 InitMergeRegion(this, source_begin + stack_base + discarded,
462 target_begin + stack_base, arity, keep_merge_stack_slots,
463 kConstantsNotAllowed, kNoReuseRegisters, used_regs);
464
465 // Initialize the locals region. Here, stack slots stay stack slots (because
466 // they do not move). Try to keep register in registers, but avoid duplicates.
467 InitMergeRegion(this, source_begin, target_begin, num_locals, kKeepStackSlots,
468 kConstantsNotAllowed, kNoReuseRegisters, used_regs);
469 // Consistency check: All the {used_regs} are really in use now.
470 DCHECK_EQ(used_regs, used_registers & used_regs)((void) 0);
471
472 // Last, initialize the section in between. Here, constants are allowed, but
473 // registers which are already used for the merge region or locals must be
474 // moved to other registers or spilled. If a register appears twice in the
475 // source region, ensure to use the same register twice in the target region.
476 InitMergeRegion(this, source_begin + num_locals, target_begin + num_locals,
477 stack_depth, kKeepStackSlots, kConstantsAllowed,
478 kReuseRegisters, used_regs);
479}
480
481void LiftoffAssembler::CacheState::Steal(const CacheState& source) {
482 // Just use the move assignment operator.
483 *this = std::move(source);
484}
485
486void LiftoffAssembler::CacheState::Split(const CacheState& source) {
487 // Call the private copy assignment operator.
488 *this = source;
489}
490
491namespace {
492
493constexpr AssemblerOptions DefaultLiftoffOptions() {
494 return AssemblerOptions{};
495}
496
497} // namespace
498
499LiftoffAssembler::LiftoffAssembler(std::unique_ptr<AssemblerBuffer> buffer)
500 : TurboAssembler(nullptr, DefaultLiftoffOptions(), CodeObjectRequired::kNo,
501 std::move(buffer)) {
502 set_abort_hard(true); // Avoid calls to Abort.
503}
504
505LiftoffAssembler::~LiftoffAssembler() {
506 if (num_locals_ > kInlineLocalTypes) {
507 free(more_local_types_);
508 }
509}
510
511LiftoffRegister LiftoffAssembler::LoadToRegister(VarState slot,
512 LiftoffRegList pinned) {
513 if (slot.is_reg()) return slot.reg();
514 LiftoffRegister reg = GetUnusedRegister(reg_class_for(slot.type()), pinned);
515 if (slot.is_const()) {
516 LoadConstant(reg, slot.constant());
517 } else {
518 DCHECK(slot.is_stack())((void) 0);
519 Fill(reg, slot.offset(), slot.type());
520 }
521 return reg;
522}
523
524LiftoffRegister LiftoffAssembler::LoadI64HalfIntoRegister(VarState slot,
525 RegPairHalf half) {
526 if (slot.is_reg()) {
527 return half == kLowWord ? slot.reg().low() : slot.reg().high();
528 }
529 LiftoffRegister dst = GetUnusedRegister(kGpReg, {});
530 if (slot.is_stack()) {
531 FillI64Half(dst.gp(), slot.offset(), half);
532 return dst;
533 }
534 DCHECK(slot.is_const())((void) 0);
535 int32_t half_word =
536 static_cast<int32_t>(half == kLowWord ? slot.constant().to_i64()
537 : slot.constant().to_i64() >> 32);
538 LoadConstant(dst, WasmValue(half_word));
539 return dst;
540}
541
542LiftoffRegister LiftoffAssembler::PeekToRegister(int index,
543 LiftoffRegList pinned) {
544 DCHECK_LT(index, cache_state_.stack_state.size())((void) 0);
545 VarState& slot = cache_state_.stack_state.end()[-1 - index];
546 if (slot.is_reg()) {
547 cache_state_.dec_used(slot.reg());
548 return slot.reg();
549 }
550 LiftoffRegister reg = LoadToRegister(slot, pinned);
551 slot.MakeRegister(reg);
552 return reg;
553}
554
555void LiftoffAssembler::PrepareLoopArgs(int num) {
556 for (int i = 0; i < num; ++i) {
557 VarState& slot = cache_state_.stack_state.end()[-1 - i];
558 if (slot.is_stack()) continue;
559 RegClass rc = reg_class_for(slot.type());
560 if (slot.is_reg()) {
561 if (cache_state_.get_use_count(slot.reg()) > 1) {
562 // If the register is used more than once, we cannot use it for the
563 // merge. Move it to an unused register instead.
564 LiftoffRegList pinned;
565 pinned.set(slot.reg());
566 LiftoffRegister dst_reg = GetUnusedRegister(rc, pinned);
567 Move(dst_reg, slot.reg(), slot.type());
568 cache_state_.dec_used(slot.reg());
569 cache_state_.inc_used(dst_reg);
570 slot.MakeRegister(dst_reg);
571 }
572 continue;
573 }
574 LiftoffRegister reg = GetUnusedRegister(rc, {});
575 LoadConstant(reg, slot.constant());
576 slot.MakeRegister(reg);
577 cache_state_.inc_used(reg);
578 }
579}
580
581void LiftoffAssembler::MergeFullStackWith(const CacheState& target,
582 const CacheState& source) {
583 DCHECK_EQ(source.stack_height(), target.stack_height())((void) 0);
584 // TODO(clemensb): Reuse the same StackTransferRecipe object to save some
585 // allocations.
586 StackTransferRecipe transfers(this);
587 for (uint32_t i = 0, e = source.stack_height(); i < e; ++i) {
588 transfers.TransferStackSlot(target.stack_state[i], source.stack_state[i]);
589 }
590}
591
592void LiftoffAssembler::MergeStackWith(const CacheState& target,
593 uint32_t arity) {
594 // Before: ----------------|----- (discarded) ----|--- arity ---|
595 // ^target_stack_height ^stack_base ^stack_height
596 // After: ----|-- arity --|
597 // ^ ^target_stack_height
598 // ^target_stack_base
599 uint32_t stack_height = cache_state_.stack_height();
600 uint32_t target_stack_height = target.stack_height();
601 DCHECK_LE(target_stack_height, stack_height)((void) 0);
602 DCHECK_LE(arity, target_stack_height)((void) 0);
603 uint32_t stack_base = stack_height - arity;
604 uint32_t target_stack_base = target_stack_height - arity;
605 StackTransferRecipe transfers(this);
606 for (uint32_t i = 0; i < target_stack_base; ++i) {
607 transfers.TransferStackSlot(target.stack_state[i],
608 cache_state_.stack_state[i]);
609 }
610 for (uint32_t i = 0; i < arity; ++i) {
611 transfers.TransferStackSlot(target.stack_state[target_stack_base + i],
612 cache_state_.stack_state[stack_base + i]);
613 }
614}
615
616void LiftoffAssembler::Spill(VarState* slot) {
617 switch (slot->loc()) {
618 case VarState::kStack:
619 return;
620 case VarState::kRegister:
621 Spill(slot->offset(), slot->reg(), slot->type());
622 cache_state_.dec_used(slot->reg());
623 break;
624 case VarState::kIntConst:
625 Spill(slot->offset(), slot->constant());
626 break;
627 }
628 slot->MakeStack();
629}
630
631void LiftoffAssembler::SpillLocals() {
632 for (uint32_t i = 0; i < num_locals_; ++i) {
633 Spill(&cache_state_.stack_state[i]);
634 }
635}
636
637void LiftoffAssembler::SpillAllRegisters() {
638 for (uint32_t i = 0, e = cache_state_.stack_height(); i < e; ++i) {
639 auto& slot = cache_state_.stack_state[i];
640 if (!slot.is_reg()) continue;
641 Spill(slot.offset(), slot.reg(), slot.type());
642 slot.MakeStack();
643 }
644 cache_state_.reset_used_registers();
645}
646
647void LiftoffAssembler::ClearRegister(
648 Register reg, std::initializer_list<Register*> possible_uses,
649 LiftoffRegList pinned) {
650 if (cache_state()->is_used(LiftoffRegister(reg))) {
651 SpillRegister(LiftoffRegister(reg));
652 }
653 Register replacement = no_reg;
654 for (Register* use : possible_uses) {
655 if (reg != *use) continue;
656 if (replacement == no_reg) {
657 replacement = GetUnusedRegister(kGpReg, pinned).gp();
658 Move(replacement, reg, LiftoffAssembler::kWasmIntPtr);
659 }
660 // We cannot leave this loop early. There may be multiple uses of {reg}.
661 *use = replacement;
662 }
663}
664
665namespace {
666void PrepareStackTransfers(const FunctionSig* sig,
667 compiler::CallDescriptor* call_descriptor,
668 const VarState* slots,
669 LiftoffStackSlots* stack_slots,
670 StackTransferRecipe* stack_transfers,
671 LiftoffRegList* param_regs) {
672 // Process parameters backwards, such that pushes of caller frame slots are
673 // in the correct order.
674 uint32_t call_desc_input_idx =
675 static_cast<uint32_t>(call_descriptor->InputCount());
676 uint32_t num_params = static_cast<uint32_t>(sig->parameter_count());
677 for (uint32_t i = num_params; i > 0; --i) {
678 const uint32_t param = i - 1;
679 ValueType type = sig->GetParam(param);
680 const bool is_gp_pair = kNeedI64RegPair && type == kWasmI64;
681 const int num_lowered_params = is_gp_pair ? 2 : 1;
682 const VarState& slot = slots[param];
683 const uint32_t stack_offset = slot.offset();
684 // Process both halfs of a register pair separately, because they are passed
685 // as separate parameters. One or both of them could end up on the stack.
686 for (int lowered_idx = 0; lowered_idx < num_lowered_params; ++lowered_idx) {
687 const RegPairHalf half =
688 is_gp_pair && lowered_idx == 0 ? kHighWord : kLowWord;
689 --call_desc_input_idx;
690 compiler::LinkageLocation loc =
691 call_descriptor->GetInputLocation(call_desc_input_idx);
692 if (loc.IsRegister()) {
693 DCHECK(!loc.IsAnyRegister())((void) 0);
694 RegClass rc = is_gp_pair ? kGpReg : reg_class_for(type);
695 int reg_code = loc.AsRegister();
696 LiftoffRegister reg =
697 LiftoffRegister::from_external_code(rc, type, reg_code);
698 param_regs->set(reg);
699 if (is_gp_pair) {
700 stack_transfers->LoadI64HalfIntoRegister(reg, slot, stack_offset,
701 half);
702 } else {
703 stack_transfers->LoadIntoRegister(reg, slot, stack_offset);
704 }
705 } else {
706 DCHECK(loc.IsCallerFrameSlot())((void) 0);
707 stack_slots->Add(slot, stack_offset, half);
708 }
709 }
710 }
711}
712
713} // namespace
714
715void LiftoffAssembler::PrepareBuiltinCall(
716 const FunctionSig* sig, compiler::CallDescriptor* call_descriptor,
717 std::initializer_list<VarState> params) {
718 LiftoffStackSlots stack_slots(this);
719 StackTransferRecipe stack_transfers(this);
720 LiftoffRegList param_regs;
721 PrepareStackTransfers(sig, call_descriptor, params.begin(), &stack_slots,
722 &stack_transfers, &param_regs);
723 // Create all the slots.
724 // Builtin stack parameters are pushed in reversed order.
725 stack_slots.Reverse();
726 stack_slots.Construct();
727 // Execute the stack transfers before filling the instance register.
728 stack_transfers.Execute();
729
730 // Reset register use counters.
731 cache_state_.reset_used_registers();
732 SpillAllRegisters();
733}
734
735void LiftoffAssembler::PrepareCall(const FunctionSig* sig,
736 compiler::CallDescriptor* call_descriptor,
737 Register* target,
738 Register* target_instance) {
739 uint32_t num_params = static_cast<uint32_t>(sig->parameter_count());
740 // Input 0 is the call target.
741 constexpr size_t kInputShift = 1;
742
743 // Spill all cache slots which are not being used as parameters.
744 for (VarState* it = cache_state_.stack_state.end() - 1 - num_params;
745 it >= cache_state_.stack_state.begin() &&
746 !cache_state_.used_registers.is_empty();
747 --it) {
748 if (!it->is_reg()) continue;
749 Spill(it->offset(), it->reg(), it->type());
750 cache_state_.dec_used(it->reg());
751 it->MakeStack();
752 }
753
754 LiftoffStackSlots stack_slots(this);
755 StackTransferRecipe stack_transfers(this);
756 LiftoffRegList param_regs;
757
758 // Move the target instance (if supplied) into the correct instance register.
759 compiler::LinkageLocation instance_loc =
760 call_descriptor->GetInputLocation(kInputShift);
761 DCHECK(instance_loc.IsRegister() && !instance_loc.IsAnyRegister())((void) 0);
762 Register instance_reg = Register::from_code(instance_loc.AsRegister());
763 param_regs.set(instance_reg);
764 if (target_instance && *target_instance != instance_reg) {
765 stack_transfers.MoveRegister(LiftoffRegister(instance_reg),
766 LiftoffRegister(*target_instance),
767 kWasmIntPtr);
768 }
769
770 if (num_params) {
771 uint32_t param_base = cache_state_.stack_height() - num_params;
772 PrepareStackTransfers(sig, call_descriptor,
773 &cache_state_.stack_state[param_base], &stack_slots,
774 &stack_transfers, &param_regs);
775 }
776
777 // If the target register overlaps with a parameter register, then move the
778 // target to another free register, or spill to the stack.
779 if (target && param_regs.has(LiftoffRegister(*target))) {
780 // Try to find another free register.
781 LiftoffRegList free_regs = kGpCacheRegList.MaskOut(param_regs);
782 if (!free_regs.is_empty()) {
783 LiftoffRegister new_target = free_regs.GetFirstRegSet();
784 stack_transfers.MoveRegister(new_target, LiftoffRegister(*target),
785 kWasmIntPtr);
786 *target = new_target.gp();
787 } else {
788 stack_slots.Add(LiftoffAssembler::VarState(LiftoffAssembler::kWasmIntPtr,
789 LiftoffRegister(*target), 0));
790 *target = no_reg;
791 }
792 }
793
794 // Create all the slots.
795 stack_slots.Construct();
796 // Execute the stack transfers before filling the instance register.
797 stack_transfers.Execute();
798 // Pop parameters from the value stack.
799 cache_state_.stack_state.pop_back(num_params);
800
801 // Reset register use counters.
802 cache_state_.reset_used_registers();
803
804 // Reload the instance from the stack.
805 if (!target_instance) {
806 FillInstanceInto(instance_reg);
807 }
808}
809
810void LiftoffAssembler::FinishCall(const FunctionSig* sig,
811 compiler::CallDescriptor* call_descriptor) {
812 // Offset of the current return value relative to the stack pointer.
813 int return_offset = 0;
814 int call_desc_return_idx = 0;
815 for (ValueType return_type : sig->returns()) {
816 DCHECK_LT(call_desc_return_idx, call_descriptor->ReturnCount())((void) 0);
817 const bool needs_gp_pair = needs_gp_reg_pair(return_type);
818 const int num_lowered_params = 1 + needs_gp_pair;
819 const ValueType lowered_type = needs_gp_pair ? kWasmI32 : return_type;
820 const RegClass rc = reg_class_for(lowered_type);
821 // Initialize to anything, will be set in the loop and used afterwards.
822 LiftoffRegister reg_pair[2] = {kGpCacheRegList.GetFirstRegSet(),
823 kGpCacheRegList.GetFirstRegSet()};
824 LiftoffRegList pinned;
825 for (int pair_idx = 0; pair_idx < num_lowered_params; ++pair_idx) {
826 compiler::LinkageLocation loc =
827 call_descriptor->GetReturnLocation(call_desc_return_idx++);
828 if (loc.IsRegister()) {
829 DCHECK(!loc.IsAnyRegister())((void) 0);
830 reg_pair[pair_idx] = LiftoffRegister::from_external_code(
831 rc, lowered_type, loc.AsRegister());
832 } else {
833 DCHECK(loc.IsCallerFrameSlot())((void) 0);
834 reg_pair[pair_idx] = GetUnusedRegister(rc, pinned);
835 LoadReturnStackSlot(reg_pair[pair_idx], return_offset, lowered_type);
836 const int type_size = lowered_type.element_size_bytes();
837 const int slot_size = RoundUp<kSystemPointerSize>(type_size);
838 return_offset += slot_size;
839 }
840 if (pair_idx == 0) {
841 pinned.set(reg_pair[0]);
842 }
843 }
844 if (num_lowered_params == 1) {
845 PushRegister(return_type, reg_pair[0]);
846 } else {
847 PushRegister(return_type, LiftoffRegister::ForPair(reg_pair[0].gp(),
848 reg_pair[1].gp()));
849 }
850 }
851 RecordUsedSpillOffset(TopSpillOffset() + return_offset);
852}
853
854void LiftoffAssembler::Move(LiftoffRegister dst, LiftoffRegister src,
855 ValueType type) {
856 DCHECK_EQ(dst.reg_class(), src.reg_class())((void) 0);
857 DCHECK_NE(dst, src)((void) 0);
858 if (kNeedI64RegPair && dst.is_gp_pair()) {
859 // Use the {StackTransferRecipe} to move pairs, as the registers in the
860 // pairs might overlap.
861 StackTransferRecipe(this).MoveRegister(dst, src, type);
862 } else if (kNeedS128RegPair && dst.is_fp_pair()) {
863 // Calling low_fp is fine, Move will automatically check the type and
864 // convert this FP to its SIMD register, and use a SIMD move.
865 Move(dst.low_fp(), src.low_fp(), type);
866 } else if (dst.is_gp()) {
867 Move(dst.gp(), src.gp(), type);
868 } else {
869 Move(dst.fp(), src.fp(), type);
870 }
871}
872
873void LiftoffAssembler::ParallelRegisterMove(
874 Vector<const ParallelRegisterMoveTuple> tuples) {
875 StackTransferRecipe stack_transfers(this);
876 for (auto tuple : tuples) {
877 if (tuple.dst == tuple.src) continue;
878 stack_transfers.MoveRegister(tuple.dst, tuple.src, tuple.type);
879 }
880}
881
882void LiftoffAssembler::MoveToReturnLocations(
883 const FunctionSig* sig, compiler::CallDescriptor* descriptor) {
884 StackTransferRecipe stack_transfers(this);
885 if (sig->return_count() == 1) {
1
Assuming the condition is false
→
2
←
Taking false branch
→
886 ValueType return_type = sig->GetReturn(0);
887 // Defaults to a gp reg, will be set below if return type is not gp.
888 LiftoffRegister return_reg = LiftoffRegister(kGpReturnRegisters[0]);
889
890 if (needs_gp_reg_pair(return_type)) {
891 return_reg = LiftoffRegister::ForPair(kGpReturnRegisters[0],
892 kGpReturnRegisters[1]);
893 } else if (needs_fp_reg_pair(return_type)) {
894 return_reg = LiftoffRegister::ForFpPair(kFpReturnRegisters[0]);
895 } else if (reg_class_for(return_type) == kFpReg) {
896 return_reg = LiftoffRegister(kFpReturnRegisters[0]);
897 } else {
898 DCHECK_EQ(kGpReg, reg_class_for(return_type))((void) 0);
899 }
900 stack_transfers.LoadIntoRegister(return_reg,
901 cache_state_.stack_state.back(),
902 cache_state_.stack_state.back().offset());
903 return;
904 }
905
906 // Slow path for multi-return.
907 int call_desc_return_idx = 0;
908 DCHECK_LE(sig->return_count(), cache_state_.stack_height())((void) 0);
909 VarState* slots = cache_state_.stack_state.end() - sig->return_count();
910 // Fill return frame slots first to ensure that all potential spills happen
911 // before we prepare the stack transfers.
912 for (size_t i = 0; i < sig->return_count(); ++i) {
3
←
Assuming the condition is true
→
4
←
Loop condition is true. Entering loop body
→
913 ValueType return_type = sig->GetReturn(i);
914 bool needs_gp_pair = needs_gp_reg_pair(return_type);
915 int num_lowered_params = 1 + needs_gp_pair;
916 for (int pair_idx = 0; pair_idx < num_lowered_params; ++pair_idx) {
5
←
Loop condition is true. Entering loop body
→
917 compiler::LinkageLocation loc =
918 descriptor->GetReturnLocation(call_desc_return_idx++);
919 if (loc.IsCallerFrameSlot()) {
6
←
Taking true branch
→
920 RegPairHalf half = pair_idx
6.1
'pair_idx' is equal to 0
6.1
'pair_idx' is equal to 0
6.1
'pair_idx' is equal to 0
 == 0 ? kLowWord : kHighWord;
7
←
'?' condition is true
→
921 VarState& slot = slots[i];
922 LiftoffRegister reg = needs_gp_pair
7.1
'needs_gp_pair' is false
7.1
'needs_gp_pair' is false
8
←
'?' condition is false
→
7.1
'needs_gp_pair' is false
923 ? LoadI64HalfIntoRegister(slot, half) 924 : LoadToRegister(slot, {}); 925 ValueType lowered_type = needs_gp_pair
8.1
'needs_gp_pair' is false
8.1
'needs_gp_pair' is false
8.1
'needs_gp_pair' is false
 ? kWasmI32 : return_type;
9
←
'?' condition is false
→
926 StoreCallerFrameSlot(reg, -loc.AsCallerFrameSlot(), lowered_type);
10
←
Calling 'LiftoffAssembler::StoreCallerFrameSlot'
→
927 } 928 } 929 } 930 // Prepare and execute stack transfers. 931 call_desc_return_idx = 0; 932 for (size_t i = 0; i < sig->return_count(); ++i) { 933 ValueType return_type = sig->GetReturn(i); 934 bool needs_gp_pair = needs_gp_reg_pair(return_type); 935 int num_lowered_params = 1 + needs_gp_pair; 936 for (int pair_idx = 0; pair_idx < num_lowered_params; ++pair_idx) { 937 RegPairHalf half = pair_idx == 0 ? kLowWord : kHighWord; 938 compiler::LinkageLocation loc = 939 descriptor->GetReturnLocation(call_desc_return_idx++); 940 if (loc.IsRegister()) { 941 DCHECK(!loc.IsAnyRegister())((void) 0); 942 int reg_code = loc.AsRegister(); 943 ValueType lowered_type = needs_gp_pair ? kWasmI32 : return_type; 944 RegClass rc = reg_class_for(lowered_type); 945 LiftoffRegister reg = 946 LiftoffRegister::from_external_code(rc, return_type, reg_code); 947 VarState& slot = slots[i]; 948 if (needs_gp_pair) { 949 stack_transfers.LoadI64HalfIntoRegister(reg, slot, slot.offset(), 950 half); 951 } else { 952 stack_transfers.LoadIntoRegister(reg, slot, slot.offset()); 953 } 954 } 955 } 956 } 957} 958 959#ifdef ENABLE_SLOW_DCHECKS 960bool LiftoffAssembler::ValidateCacheState() const { 961 uint32_t register_use_count[kAfterMaxLiftoffRegCode] = {0}; 962 LiftoffRegList used_regs; 963 for (const VarState& var : cache_state_.stack_state) { 964 if (!var.is_reg()) continue; 965 LiftoffRegister reg = var.reg(); 966 if ((kNeedI64RegPair || kNeedS128RegPair) && reg.is_pair()) { 967 ++register_use_count[reg.low().liftoff_code()]; 968 ++register_use_count[reg.high().liftoff_code()]; 969 } else { 970 ++register_use_count[reg.liftoff_code()]; 971 } 972 used_regs.set(reg); 973 } 974 bool valid = memcmp(register_use_count, cache_state_.register_use_count, 975 sizeof(register_use_count)) == 0 && 976 used_regs == cache_state_.used_registers; 977 if (valid) return true; 978 std::ostringstream os; 979 os << "Error in LiftoffAssembler::ValidateCacheState().\n"; 980 os << "expected: used_regs " << used_regs << ", counts " 981 << PrintCollection(register_use_count) << "\n"; 982 os << "found: used_regs " << cache_state_.used_registers << ", counts " 983 << PrintCollection(cache_state_.register_use_count) << "\n"; 984 os << "Use --trace-wasm-decoder and --trace-liftoff to debug."; 985 FATAL("%s", os.str().c_str())V8_Fatal("%s", os.str().c_str()); 986} 987#endif 988 989LiftoffRegister LiftoffAssembler::SpillOneRegister(LiftoffRegList candidates, 990 LiftoffRegList pinned) { 991 // Spill one cached value to free a register. 992 LiftoffRegister spill_reg = cache_state_.GetNextSpillReg(candidates, pinned); 993 SpillRegister(spill_reg); 994 return spill_reg; 995} 996 997LiftoffRegister LiftoffAssembler::SpillAdjacentFpRegisters( 998 LiftoffRegList pinned) { 999 // We end up in this call only when: 1000 // [1] kNeedS128RegPair, and 1001 // [2] there are no pair of adjacent FP registers that are free 1002 CHECK(kNeedS128RegPair)do { if ((__builtin_expect(!!(!(kNeedS128RegPair)), 0))) { V8_Fatal
("Check failed: %s.", "kNeedS128RegPair"); } } while (false); 1003 DCHECK(!kFpCacheRegList.MaskOut(pinned)((void) 0) 1004 .MaskOut(cache_state_.used_registers)((void) 0) 1005 .HasAdjacentFpRegsSet())((void) 0); 1006 1007 // Special logic, if the top fp register is even, we might hit a case of an 1008 // invalid register in case 2. 1009 LiftoffRegister last_fp = kFpCacheRegList.GetLastRegSet(); 1010 if (last_fp.fp().code() % 2 == 0) { 1011 pinned.set(last_fp); 1012 } 1013 1014 // We can try to optimize the spilling here: 1015 // 1. Try to get a free fp register, either: 1016 // a. This register is already free, or 1017 // b. it had to be spilled. 1018 // 2. If 1a, the adjacent register is used (invariant [2]), spill it. 1019 // 3. If 1b, check the adjacent register: 1020 // a. If free, done! 1021 // b. If used, spill it. 1022 // We spill one register in 2 and 3a, and two registers in 3b. 1023 1024 LiftoffRegister first_reg = GetUnusedRegister(kFpCacheRegList, pinned); 1025 LiftoffRegister second_reg = first_reg, low_reg = first_reg; 1026 1027 if (first_reg.fp().code() % 2 == 0) { 1028 second_reg = 1029 LiftoffRegister::from_liftoff_code(first_reg.liftoff_code() + 1); 1030 } else { 1031 second_reg = 1032 LiftoffRegister::from_liftoff_code(first_reg.liftoff_code() - 1); 1033 low_reg = second_reg; 1034 } 1035 1036 if (cache_state_.is_used(second_reg)) { 1037 SpillRegister(second_reg); 1038 } 1039 1040 return low_reg; 1041} 1042 1043void LiftoffAssembler::SpillRegister(LiftoffRegister reg) { 1044 int remaining_uses = cache_state_.get_use_count(reg); 1045 DCHECK_LT(0, remaining_uses)((void) 0); 1046 for (uint32_t idx = cache_state_.stack_height() - 1;; --idx) { 1047 DCHECK_GT(cache_state_.stack_height(), idx)((void) 0); 1048 auto* slot = &cache_state_.stack_state[idx]; 1049 if (!slot->is_reg() || !slot->reg().overlaps(reg)) continue; 1050 if (slot->reg().is_pair()) { 1051 // Make sure to decrement *both* registers in a pair, because the 1052 // {clear_used} call below only clears one of them. 1053 cache_state_.dec_used(slot->reg().low()); 1054 cache_state_.dec_used(slot->reg().high()); 1055 cache_state_.last_spilled_regs.set(slot->reg().low()); 1056 cache_state_.last_spilled_regs.set(slot->reg().high()); 1057 } 1058 Spill(slot->offset(), slot->reg(), slot->type()); 1059 slot->MakeStack(); 1060 if (--remaining_uses == 0) break; 1061 } 1062 cache_state_.clear_used(reg); 1063 cache_state_.last_spilled_regs.set(reg); 1064} 1065 1066void LiftoffAssembler::set_num_locals(uint32_t num_locals) { 1067 DCHECK_EQ(0, num_locals_)((void) 0); // only call this once. 1068 num_locals_ = num_locals; 1069 if (num_locals > kInlineLocalTypes) { 1070 more_local_types_ = 1071 reinterpret_cast<ValueType*>(malloc(num_locals * sizeof(ValueType))); 1072 DCHECK_NOT_NULL(more_local_types_)((void) 0); 1073 } 1074} 1075 1076std::ostream& operator<<(std::ostream& os, VarState slot) { 1077 os << slot.type().name() << ":"; 1078 switch (slot.loc()) { 1079 case VarState::kStack: 1080 return os << "s"; 1081 case VarState::kRegister: 1082 return os << slot.reg(); 1083 case VarState::kIntConst: 1084 return os << "c" << slot.i32_const(); 1085 } 1086 UNREACHABLE()V8_Fatal("unreachable code"); 1087} 1088 1089} // namespace wasm 1090} // namespace internal 1091} // namespace v8
←

../deps/v8/src/wasm/baseline/x64/liftoff-assembler-x64.h

1// Copyright 2017 the V8 project authors. All rights reserved.
2// Use of this source code is governed by a BSD-style license that can be
3// found in the LICENSE file.

5#ifndef V8_WASM_BASELINE_X64_LIFTOFF_ASSEMBLER_X64_H_
6#define V8_WASM_BASELINE_X64_LIFTOFF_ASSEMBLER_X64_H_
7
8#include "src/codegen/assembler.h"
9#include "src/wasm/baseline/liftoff-assembler.h"
10#include "src/wasm/simd-shuffle.h"
11
12namespace v8 {
13namespace internal {
14namespace wasm {
15
16#define RETURN_FALSE_IF_MISSING_CPU_FEATURE(name) \
17 if (!CpuFeatures::IsSupported(name)) return false; \
18 CpuFeatureScope feature(this, name);
19
20namespace liftoff {
21
22constexpr Register kScratchRegister2 = r11;
23static_assert(kScratchRegister != kScratchRegister2, "collision");
24static_assert((kLiftoffAssemblerGpCacheRegs &
25 Register::ListOf(kScratchRegister, kScratchRegister2)) == 0,
26 "scratch registers must not be used as cache registers");
27
28constexpr DoubleRegister kScratchDoubleReg2 = xmm14;
29static_assert(kScratchDoubleReg != kScratchDoubleReg2, "collision");
30static_assert((kLiftoffAssemblerFpCacheRegs &
31 DoubleRegister::ListOf(kScratchDoubleReg, kScratchDoubleReg2)) ==
32 0,
33 "scratch registers must not be used as cache registers");
34
35// rbp-8 holds the stack marker, rbp-16 is the instance parameter.
36constexpr int kInstanceOffset = 16;
37
38inline Operand GetStackSlot(int offset) { return Operand(rbp, -offset); }
39
40// TODO(clemensb): Make this a constexpr variable once Operand is constexpr.
41inline Operand GetInstanceOperand() { return GetStackSlot(kInstanceOffset); }
42
43inline Operand GetMemOp(LiftoffAssembler* assm, Register addr, Register offset,
44 uint32_t offset_imm) {
45 if (is_uint31(offset_imm)) {
46 if (offset == no_reg) return Operand(addr, offset_imm);
47 return Operand(addr, offset, times_1, offset_imm);
48 }
49 // Offset immediate does not fit in 31 bits.
50 Register scratch = kScratchRegister;
51 assm->movl(scratch, Immediate(offset_imm));
52 if (offset != no_reg) {
53 assm->addq(scratch, offset);
54 }
55 return Operand(addr, scratch, times_1, 0);
56}
57
58inline void Load(LiftoffAssembler* assm, LiftoffRegister dst, Operand src,
59 ValueType type) {
60 switch (type.kind()) {
61 case ValueType::kI32:
62 assm->movl(dst.gp(), src);
63 break;
64 case ValueType::kI64:
65 assm->movq(dst.gp(), src);
66 break;
67 case ValueType::kF32:
68 assm->Movss(dst.fp(), src);
69 break;
70 case ValueType::kF64:
71 assm->Movsd(dst.fp(), src);
72 break;
73 case ValueType::kS128:
74 assm->Movdqu(dst.fp(), src);
75 break;
76 default:
77 UNREACHABLE()V8_Fatal("unreachable code");
78 }
79}
80
81inline void Store(LiftoffAssembler* assm, Operand dst, LiftoffRegister src,
82 ValueType type) {
83 switch (type.kind()) {
84 case ValueType::kI32:
85 assm->movl(dst, src.gp());
86 break;
87 case ValueType::kI64:
88 assm->movq(dst, src.gp());
89 break;
90 case ValueType::kF32:
91 assm->Movss(dst, src.fp());
92 break;
93 case ValueType::kF64:
94 assm->Movsd(dst, src.fp());
95 break;
96 case ValueType::kS128:
97 assm->Movdqu(dst, src.fp());
98 break;
99 default:
100 UNREACHABLE()V8_Fatal("unreachable code");
101 }
102}
103
104inline void push(LiftoffAssembler* assm, LiftoffRegister reg, ValueType type) {
105 switch (type.kind()) {
106 case ValueType::kI32:
107 case ValueType::kI64:
108 assm->pushq(reg.gp());
109 break;
110 case ValueType::kF32:
111 assm->AllocateStackSpace(kSystemPointerSize);
112 assm->Movss(Operand(rsp, 0), reg.fp());
113 break;
114 case ValueType::kF64:
115 assm->AllocateStackSpace(kSystemPointerSize);
116 assm->Movsd(Operand(rsp, 0), reg.fp());
117 break;
118 case ValueType::kS128:
119 assm->AllocateStackSpace(kSystemPointerSize * 2);
120 assm->Movdqu(Operand(rsp, 0), reg.fp());
121 break;
122 default:
123 UNREACHABLE()V8_Fatal("unreachable code");
124 }
125}
126
127constexpr int kSubSpSize = 7; // 7 bytes for "subq rsp, <imm32>"
128
129} // namespace liftoff
130
131int LiftoffAssembler::PrepareStackFrame() {
132 int offset = pc_offset();
133 sub_sp_32(0);
134 DCHECK_EQ(liftoff::kSubSpSize, pc_offset() - offset)((void) 0);
135 return offset;
136}
137
138void LiftoffAssembler::PrepareTailCall(int num_callee_stack_params,
139 int stack_param_delta) {
140 // Push the return address and frame pointer to complete the stack frame.
141 pushq(Operand(rbp, 8));
142 pushq(Operand(rbp, 0));
143
144 // Shift the whole frame upwards.
145 const int slot_count = num_callee_stack_params + 2;
146 for (int i = slot_count - 1; i >= 0; --i) {
147 movq(kScratchRegister, Operand(rsp, i * 8));
148 movq(Operand(rbp, (i - stack_param_delta) * 8), kScratchRegister);
149 }
150
151 // Set the new stack and frame pointer.
152 leaq(rsp, Operand(rbp, -stack_param_delta * 8));
153 popq(rbp);
154}
155
156void LiftoffAssembler::PatchPrepareStackFrame(int offset, int frame_size) {
157 // Need to align sp to system pointer size.
158 frame_size = RoundUp(frame_size, kSystemPointerSize);
159 // We can't run out of space, just pass anything big enough to not cause the
160 // assembler to try to grow the buffer.
161 constexpr int kAvailableSpace = 64;
162 Assembler patching_assembler(
163 AssemblerOptions{},
164 ExternalAssemblerBuffer(buffer_start_ + offset, kAvailableSpace));
165#if V8_OS_WIN
166 if (frame_size > kStackPageSize) {
167 // Generate OOL code (at the end of the function, where the current
168 // assembler is pointing) to do the explicit stack limit check (see
169 // https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/previous-versions/visualstudio/visual-studio-6.0/aa227153(v=vs.60)).
170 // At the function start, emit a jump to that OOL code (from {offset} to
171 // {pc_offset()}).
172 int ool_offset = pc_offset() - offset;
173 patching_assembler.jmp_rel(ool_offset);
174 DCHECK_GE(liftoff::kSubSpSize, patching_assembler.pc_offset())((void) 0);
175 patching_assembler.Nop(liftoff::kSubSpSize -
176 patching_assembler.pc_offset());
177
178 // Now generate the OOL code.
179 AllocateStackSpace(frame_size);
180 // Jump back to the start of the function (from {pc_offset()} to {offset +
181 // kSubSpSize}).
182 int func_start_offset = offset + liftoff::kSubSpSize - pc_offset();
183 jmp_rel(func_start_offset);
184 return;
185 }
186#endif
187 patching_assembler.sub_sp_32(frame_size);
188 DCHECK_EQ(liftoff::kSubSpSize, patching_assembler.pc_offset())((void) 0);
189}
190
191void LiftoffAssembler::FinishCode() {}
192
193void LiftoffAssembler::AbortCompilation() {}
194
195// static
196constexpr int LiftoffAssembler::StaticStackFrameSize() {
197 return liftoff::kInstanceOffset;
198}
199
200int LiftoffAssembler::SlotSizeForType(ValueType type) {
201 return type.element_size_bytes();
202}
203
204bool LiftoffAssembler::NeedsAlignment(ValueType type) { return false; }
205
206void LiftoffAssembler::LoadConstant(LiftoffRegister reg, WasmValue value,
207 RelocInfo::Mode rmode) {
208 switch (value.type().kind()) {
209 case ValueType::kI32:
210 if (value.to_i32() == 0 && RelocInfo::IsNone(rmode)) {
211 xorl(reg.gp(), reg.gp());
212 } else {
213 movl(reg.gp(), Immediate(value.to_i32(), rmode));
214 }
215 break;
216 case ValueType::kI64:
217 if (RelocInfo::IsNone(rmode)) {
218 TurboAssembler::Set(reg.gp(), value.to_i64());
219 } else {
220 movq(reg.gp(), Immediate64(value.to_i64(), rmode));
221 }
222 break;
223 case ValueType::kF32:
224 TurboAssembler::Move(reg.fp(), value.to_f32_boxed().get_bits());
225 break;
226 case ValueType::kF64:
227 TurboAssembler::Move(reg.fp(), value.to_f64_boxed().get_bits());
228 break;
229 default:
230 UNREACHABLE()V8_Fatal("unreachable code");
231 }
232}
233
234void LiftoffAssembler::LoadFromInstance(Register dst, uint32_t offset,
235 int size) {
236 DCHECK_LE(offset, kMaxInt)((void) 0);
237 movq(dst, liftoff::GetInstanceOperand());
238 DCHECK(size == 4 || size == 8)((void) 0);
239 if (size == 4) {
240 movl(dst, Operand(dst, offset));
241 } else {
242 movq(dst, Operand(dst, offset));
243 }
244}
245
246void LiftoffAssembler::LoadTaggedPointerFromInstance(Register dst,
247 uint32_t offset) {
248 DCHECK_LE(offset, kMaxInt)((void) 0);
249 movq(dst, liftoff::GetInstanceOperand());
250 LoadTaggedPointerField(dst, Operand(dst, offset));
251}
252
253void LiftoffAssembler::SpillInstance(Register instance) {
254 movq(liftoff::GetInstanceOperand(), instance);
255}
256
257void LiftoffAssembler::FillInstanceInto(Register dst) {
258 movq(dst, liftoff::GetInstanceOperand());
259}
260
261void LiftoffAssembler::LoadTaggedPointer(Register dst, Register src_addr,
262 Register offset_reg,
263 int32_t offset_imm,
264 LiftoffRegList pinned) {
265 DCHECK_GE(offset_imm, 0)((void) 0);
266 if (emit_debug_code() && offset_reg != no_reg) {
267 AssertZeroExtended(offset_reg);
268 }
269 Operand src_op = liftoff::GetMemOp(this, src_addr, offset_reg,
270 static_cast<uint32_t>(offset_imm));
271 LoadTaggedPointerField(dst, src_op);
272}
273
274void LiftoffAssembler::AtomicLoad(LiftoffRegister dst, Register src_addr,
275 Register offset_reg, uint32_t offset_imm,
276 LoadType type, LiftoffRegList pinned) {
277 Load(dst, src_addr, offset_reg, offset_imm, type, pinned, nullptr, true);
278}
279
280void LiftoffAssembler::Load(LiftoffRegister dst, Register src_addr,
281 Register offset_reg, uint32_t offset_imm,
282 LoadType type, LiftoffRegList pinned,
283 uint32_t* protected_load_pc, bool is_load_mem) {
284 if (emit_debug_code() && offset_reg != no_reg) {
285 AssertZeroExtended(offset_reg);
286 }
287 Operand src_op = liftoff::GetMemOp(this, src_addr, offset_reg, offset_imm);
288 if (protected_load_pc) *protected_load_pc = pc_offset();
289 switch (type.value()) {
290 case LoadType::kI32Load8U:
291 case LoadType::kI64Load8U:
292 movzxbl(dst.gp(), src_op);
293 break;
294 case LoadType::kI32Load8S:
295 movsxbl(dst.gp(), src_op);
296 break;
297 case LoadType::kI64Load8S:
298 movsxbq(dst.gp(), src_op);
299 break;
300 case LoadType::kI32Load16U:
301 case LoadType::kI64Load16U:
302 movzxwl(dst.gp(), src_op);
303 break;
304 case LoadType::kI32Load16S:
305 movsxwl(dst.gp(), src_op);
306 break;
307 case LoadType::kI64Load16S:
308 movsxwq(dst.gp(), src_op);
309 break;
310 case LoadType::kI32Load:
311 case LoadType::kI64Load32U:
312 movl(dst.gp(), src_op);
313 break;
314 case LoadType::kI64Load32S:
315 movsxlq(dst.gp(), src_op);
316 break;
317 case LoadType::kI64Load:
318 movq(dst.gp(), src_op);
319 break;
320 case LoadType::kF32Load:
321 Movss(dst.fp(), src_op);
322 break;
323 case LoadType::kF64Load:
324 Movsd(dst.fp(), src_op);
325 break;
326 case LoadType::kS128Load:
327 Movdqu(dst.fp(), src_op);
328 break;
329 }
330}
331
332void LiftoffAssembler::Store(Register dst_addr, Register offset_reg,
333 uint32_t offset_imm, LiftoffRegister src,
334 StoreType type, LiftoffRegList /* pinned */,
335 uint32_t* protected_store_pc, bool is_store_mem) {
336 if (emit_debug_code() && offset_reg != no_reg) {
337 AssertZeroExtended(offset_reg);
338 }
339 Operand dst_op = liftoff::GetMemOp(this, dst_addr, offset_reg, offset_imm);
340 if (protected_store_pc) *protected_store_pc = pc_offset();
341 switch (type.value()) {
342 case StoreType::kI32Store8:
343 case StoreType::kI64Store8:
344 movb(dst_op, src.gp());
345 break;
346 case StoreType::kI32Store16:
347 case StoreType::kI64Store16:
348 movw(dst_op, src.gp());
349 break;
350 case StoreType::kI32Store:
351 case StoreType::kI64Store32:
352 movl(dst_op, src.gp());
353 break;
354 case StoreType::kI64Store:
355 movq(dst_op, src.gp());
356 break;
357 case StoreType::kF32Store:
358 Movss(dst_op, src.fp());
359 break;
360 case StoreType::kF64Store:
361 Movsd(dst_op, src.fp());
362 break;
363 case StoreType::kS128Store:
364 Movdqu(dst_op, src.fp());
365 break;
366 }
367}
368
369void LiftoffAssembler::AtomicStore(Register dst_addr, Register offset_reg,
370 uint32_t offset_imm, LiftoffRegister src,
371 StoreType type, LiftoffRegList pinned) {
372 if (emit_debug_code() && offset_reg != no_reg) {
373 AssertZeroExtended(offset_reg);
374 }
375 Operand dst_op = liftoff::GetMemOp(this, dst_addr, offset_reg, offset_imm);
376 Register src_reg = src.gp();
377 if (cache_state()->is_used(src)) {
378 movq(kScratchRegister, src_reg);
379 src_reg = kScratchRegister;
380 }
381 switch (type.value()) {
382 case StoreType::kI32Store8:
383 case StoreType::kI64Store8:
384 xchgb(src_reg, dst_op);
385 break;
386 case StoreType::kI32Store16:
387 case StoreType::kI64Store16:
388 xchgw(src_reg, dst_op);
389 break;
390 case StoreType::kI32Store:
391 case StoreType::kI64Store32:
392 xchgl(src_reg, dst_op);
393 break;
394 case StoreType::kI64Store:
395 xchgq(src_reg, dst_op);
396 break;
397 default:
398 UNREACHABLE()V8_Fatal("unreachable code");
399 }
400}
401
402void LiftoffAssembler::AtomicAdd(Register dst_addr, Register offset_reg,
403 uint32_t offset_imm, LiftoffRegister value,
404 LiftoffRegister result, StoreType type) {
405 DCHECK(!cache_state()->is_used(result))((void) 0);
406 if (cache_state()->is_used(value)) {
407 // We cannot overwrite {value}, but the {value} register is changed in the
408 // code we generate. Therefore we copy {value} to {result} and use the
409 // {result} register in the code below.
410 movq(result.gp(), value.gp());
411 value = result;
412 }
413 if (emit_debug_code() && offset_reg != no_reg) {
414 AssertZeroExtended(offset_reg);
415 }
416 Operand dst_op = liftoff::GetMemOp(this, dst_addr, offset_reg, offset_imm);
417 lock();
418 switch (type.value()) {
419 case StoreType::kI32Store8:
420 case StoreType::kI64Store8:
421 xaddb(dst_op, value.gp());
422 movzxbq(result.gp(), value.gp());
423 break;
424 case StoreType::kI32Store16:
425 case StoreType::kI64Store16:
426 xaddw(dst_op, value.gp());
427 movzxwq(result.gp(), value.gp());
428 break;
429 case StoreType::kI32Store:
430 case StoreType::kI64Store32:
431 xaddl(dst_op, value.gp());
432 if (value != result) {
433 movq(result.gp(), value.gp());
434 }
435 break;
436 case StoreType::kI64Store:
437 xaddq(dst_op, value.gp());
438 if (value != result) {
439 movq(result.gp(), value.gp());
440 }
441 break;
442 default:
443 UNREACHABLE()V8_Fatal("unreachable code");
444 }
445}
446
447void LiftoffAssembler::AtomicSub(Register dst_addr, Register offset_reg,
448 uint32_t offset_imm, LiftoffRegister value,
449 LiftoffRegister result, StoreType type) {
450 DCHECK(!cache_state()->is_used(result))((void) 0);
451 if (cache_state()->is_used(value)) {
452 // We cannot overwrite {value}, but the {value} register is changed in the
453 // code we generate. Therefore we copy {value} to {result} and use the
454 // {result} register in the code below.
455 movq(result.gp(), value.gp());
456 value = result;
457 }
458 if (emit_debug_code() && offset_reg != no_reg) {
459 AssertZeroExtended(offset_reg);
460 }
461 Operand dst_op = liftoff::GetMemOp(this, dst_addr, offset_reg, offset_imm);
462 switch (type.value()) {
463 case StoreType::kI32Store8:
464 case StoreType::kI64Store8:
465 negb(value.gp());
466 lock();
467 xaddb(dst_op, value.gp());
468 movzxbq(result.gp(), value.gp());
469 break;
470 case StoreType::kI32Store16:
471 case StoreType::kI64Store16:
472 negw(value.gp());
473 lock();
474 xaddw(dst_op, value.gp());
475 movzxwq(result.gp(), value.gp());
476 break;
477 case StoreType::kI32Store:
478 case StoreType::kI64Store32:
479 negl(value.gp());
480 lock();
481 xaddl(dst_op, value.gp());
482 if (value != result) {
483 movq(result.gp(), value.gp());
484 }
485 break;
486 case StoreType::kI64Store:
487 negq(value.gp());
488 lock();
489 xaddq(dst_op, value.gp());
490 if (value != result) {
491 movq(result.gp(), value.gp());
492 }
493 break;
494 default:
495 UNREACHABLE()V8_Fatal("unreachable code");
496 }
497}
498
499namespace liftoff {
500#define __ lasm->
501
502inline void AtomicBinop(LiftoffAssembler* lasm,
503 void (Assembler::*opl)(Register, Register),
504 void (Assembler::*opq)(Register, Register),
505 Register dst_addr, Register offset_reg,
506 uint32_t offset_imm, LiftoffRegister value,
507 LiftoffRegister result, StoreType type) {
508 DCHECK(!__ cache_state()->is_used(result))((void) 0);
509 Register value_reg = value.gp();
510 // The cmpxchg instruction uses rax to store the old value of the
511 // compare-exchange primitive. Therefore we have to spill the register and
512 // move any use to another register.
513 LiftoffRegList pinned =
514 LiftoffRegList::ForRegs(dst_addr, offset_reg, value_reg);
515 __ ClearRegister(rax, {&dst_addr, &offset_reg, &value_reg}, pinned);
516 if (__ emit_debug_code() && offset_reg != no_reg) {
517 __ AssertZeroExtended(offset_reg);
518 }
519 Operand dst_op = liftoff::GetMemOp(lasm, dst_addr, offset_reg, offset_imm);
520
521 switch (type.value()) {
522 case StoreType::kI32Store8:
523 case StoreType::kI64Store8: {
524 Label binop;
525 __ xorq(rax, rax);
526 __ movb(rax, dst_op);
527 __ bind(&binop);
528 __ movl(kScratchRegister, rax);
529 (lasm->*opl)(kScratchRegister, value_reg);
530 __ lock();
531 __ cmpxchgb(dst_op, kScratchRegister);
532 __ j(not_equal, &binop);
533 break;
534 }
535 case StoreType::kI32Store16:
536 case StoreType::kI64Store16: {
537 Label binop;
538 __ xorq(rax, rax);
539 __ movw(rax, dst_op);
540 __ bind(&binop);
541 __ movl(kScratchRegister, rax);
